Class GraphDB

  • Object
    • GraphDB

  • public class GraphDB
extends Object
    Graph for storing all of the intersection (vertex) and road (edge) information. Uses your GraphBuildingHandler to convert the XML files into a graph. Your code must include the vertices, adjacent, distance, closest, lat, and lon methods. You'll also need to include instance variables and methods for modifying the graph (e.g. addNode and addEdge).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GraphDB​(String dbPath)
      Example constructor shows how to create and start an XML parser.

      Returns the initial bearing (angle) between vertices v and w in degrees.
      (package private) static String cleanString​(String s)
      Helper to process strings into their "cleaned" form, ignoring punctuation and capitalization.

      Returns the vertex closest to the given longitude and latitude.
      (package private) double distance​(long v, long w)
      Returns the great-circle distance between vertices v and w in miles.

      Gets the latitude of a vertex.
      (package private) double lon​(long v)

    • Constructor Detail

      • GraphDB

        public GraphDB​(String dbPath)
        Example constructor shows how to create and start an XML parser. You do not need to modify this constructor, but you're welcome to do so.
        Parameters:
        dbPath - Path to the XML file to be parsed.

    • Method Detail

      • cleanString

        static String cleanString​(String s)
        Helper to process strings into their "cleaned" form, ignoring punctuation and capitalization.
        Parameters:
        s - Input string.
        Returns:
        Cleaned string.

      • vertices

        Iterable<Long> vertices​()
        Returns an iterable of all vertex IDs in the graph.
        Returns:
        An iterable of id's of all vertices in the graph.

      • adjacent

        Iterable<Long> adjacent​(long v)
        Returns ids of all vertices adjacent to v.
        Parameters:
        v - The id of the vertex we are looking adjacent to.
        Returns:
        An iterable of the ids of the neighbors of v.

      • distance

        double distance​(long v,
                long w)
        Returns the great-circle distance between vertices v and w in miles. Assumes the lon/lat methods are implemented properly. Source.
        Parameters:
        v - The id of the first vertex.
        w - The id of the second vertex.
        Returns:
        The great-circle distance between the two locations from the graph.

      • bearing

        double bearing​(long v,
               long w)
        Returns the initial bearing (angle) between vertices v and w in degrees. The initial bearing is the angle that, if followed in a straight line along a great-circle arc from the starting point, would take you to the end point. Assumes the lon/lat methods are implemented properly. Source.
        Parameters:
        v - The id of the first vertex.
        w - The id of the second vertex.
        Returns:
        The initial bearing between the vertices.

      • closest

        long closest​(double lon,
             double lat)
        Returns the vertex closest to the given longitude and latitude.
        Parameters:
        lon - The target longitude.
        lat - The target latitude.
        Returns:
        The id of the node in the graph closest to the target.

      • lon

        double lon​(long v)
        Gets the longitude of a vertex.
        Parameters:
        v - The id of the vertex.
        Returns:
        The longitude of the vertex.

      • lat

        double lat​(long v)
        Gets the latitude of a vertex.
        Parameters:
        v - The id of the vertex.
        Returns:
        The latitude of the vertex.
